title-part.text: NUCLEAR REACTORS

reference.text: analogue computers therefor G06G7/54; fusion reactors, hybrid fission-fusion reactors G21B; nuclear explosives G21J

note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not used in the CPC scheme:
- G21C1/01 covered by all other groups of G21C
- G21C19/33 covered by all other subgroups of G21C19/34

title-part.text: Reactors
Fast fission reactors, i.e. reactors not using a moderator;

CPC-specific-text.text: Characterised by the concept and properties of the core
where the core is divided in zones with fuel and zones with breeding material
Reactors not needing refueling, i.e. reactors of the type breed-and-burn, e.g. travelling or deflagration wave reactors or seed-blanket reactors

reference.text: cooling arrangements G21C15/00

title-part.text: cooled by a coolant not essentially pressurised, e.g. pool-type reactors
Thermal reactors;
Heterogeneous reactors, i.e. in which fuel and moderator are separated
Pebble-bed reactors
Reactors with granular fuel
moderator being highly pressurised, e.g. boiling water reactor, integral super-heat reactor, pressurised water reactor

reference.text: G21C1/22 takes precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: Reactors where the coolant is overheated

title-part.text: Pressure regulating arrangements, i.e. pressurisers
moderator and coolant being different or separated
moderator being solid, e.g. Magnox reactor
moderator being substantially not pressurised, e.g. swimming-pool reactor

reference.text: G21C1/22 takes precedence

title-part.text: moderator and coolant being different or separated, e.g. sodium-graphite reactor

CPC-specific-text.text: sodium-heavy water reactor, organic coolant-heavy water reactor

title-part.text: coolant being pressurised
moderator being liquid, e.g. pressure-tube reactor

CPC-specific-text.text: also the construction of the pressure-tubes

title-part.text: using liquid or gaseous fuel
Homogeneous reactors, i.e. in which the fuel and moderator present an effectively homogeneous medium to the neutrons
Single-region reactors
Two-region reactors
Subcritical reactors;

CPC-specific-text.text: Experimental reactors with exception of swimming-pool reactors or zero-energy reactors
Experimental and irradiation arrangements inside the reactor

reference.text: irradiation loops G21C1/306; material testing by neutrons G01N23/005

title-part.text: Integral reactors, i.e. reactors wherein parts functionally associated with the reactor but not essential to the reaction, e.g. heat exchangers, are disposed inside the enclosure with the core

reference.text: G21C1/02 to G21C1/30 take precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: wherein the heat exchanger is disposed above the core
wherein the heat exchanger is disposed beneath the core
wherein the heat exchanger is disposed next to or beside the core
wherein the prime mover is also disposed in the vessel
